title: What is the difference between web conferencing and video conferencing? - Quora

response.answer_text: This two are seen as the same technology under different names with some differences. video conferencing provides a two way visual or audio communication between two or more people who are in different locations via video or audio streams. It provides a real-time linkup between people over the internet in a way that is similar to the traditional face-to-face meeting environment. Web Conferencing provides a live audio or video communication over the internet between two or more locations to communicate and share information. Through a web conference, a presenter can share information or communicate to a group of geographically dispersed participants. Main difference between web conferencing and video conferencing: The main objective of web conferencing is content sharing while in video conferencing, its main objective is live communication. Video conferencing is ideal at face-to-face communication, building cordial relationship with teams, encouraging collaboration, and obtaining feedback. Web conferencing is ideal for face-to-face communication among individuals in different geographical locations, hosting impromptu meetings, and delivering a large amount of information one way to a group. Some other difference is: Number of Viewers: With web conferencing, users are unlimited unlike in video conferencing where the number of viewers is limited by the video conferencing server’s capacity. Areas of Application: Web conferencing is applied in presentations, online training and distance learning. For video conferencing, the solution substitutes business or personal trips for users. The solution is applied in occasional and regular meetings, negotiations, and discussions.

People often use both terms interchangeably but they aren’t the same thing. In this answer, I’ll share with you what both terms mean, what platforms you can use for each category, and when you can use them. Let’s get started. What’s web conferencing?  Image source: Remo conference Web conferencing is a real-time or pre-recorded event that uses audio and video communication. A popular form of web conferencing is webinars that can be accessed through web browsers or local meetings software. What platforms can I use for web conferencing? Some of the best platforms for web conferencing are WebinarJam (ideal for sales and marketing), ON24 (general-purpose tool), and Remo Conference (perfect for online events and summits). When should I use web conferencing? Web conferencing is perfect for the external distribution of information. For example, let’s say your company wants to share some information with third parties, webinars and presentations are a great way of doing that. Think of the Apple, Google, and Nvidia events. What’s video conferencing? Video conferencing is a technology that lets you have real-time face-to-face online meetings with one or more people. These are also known as video calls. What platforms can I use for video conferencing?  Image source: The Record Some of the platforms you can use for video conferencing are FaceTime, Google Meet, Zoom meetings, Skype, and Remo. When should I use video conferencing? Video conferencing is great for internal communications with your team (or family) members. If you want to have a private conversation with someone on your team, video conferencing is the way to go. I hope you found that information useful. If you did, could you tap the upvote button? It helps me know you found the answer helpful. Thank you in advance.
